rules: Rule1: Provided that artwork1 is loaned, it is exhibited.
Rule2: Whenever artwork1 is forged, it follows that it is recovered.
Rule3: Supposing that artwork1 is confiscated, then it is not recovered.
Rule4: Provided that artwork1 is purchased, it does not hold that it is donated.
Rule5: Under the condition that artwork1 is revalued, it is undervalued.
Rule6: If artwork1 is insured, then it is not the case that it is covered.
Rule7: Either artwork1 is insured, or if it is valuable, then provided that facility1 is not secured, artwork1 becomes damaged.
Rule8: Provided that insurance1 is policy active, then if artwork1 is insured, it is covered.
Rule9: If artwork1 is authenticated, then it is not stolen.
Rule10: Provided that artwork1 is exhibited, it is not stolen.
Rule11: Artwork1 is restored or artwork1 is loaned.
Rule12: If it is not the case that forged artwork1 implies it is confiscated, then artwork1 is investigated.
Rule13: If it is not the case that valuable artwork1 implies that non-secured facility1 leads to damaged artwork1, then artwork1 is donated.
Rule14: Under the condition that it is not true that restored artwork1 implies it is authenticated, then artwork1 is forged.
Rule15: If it is not the case that the non-implication of appraised artwork1 not implying non-sold leads to revalued artwork1, then artwork1 is litigated.
Rule16: Provided that artwork1 is not purchased, it is sold.
Rule17: Under the condition that facility1 is not secured, artwork1 is stolen.
Rule18: Supposing that facility1 is not secured, then it is not the case that artwork1 is damaged.
